data.title: On This Day: Spanish Royal Family
data.meta_description:

1598

data.text:
September 13

1598

Today in Royal History is the 421st Death Anniversary of Philip II of Spain, the second King of Spain from the House of Habsburg. At some point of his lifetime, he was also the King of Portugal as the first monarch from the House of Habsburg and the King of England and Ireland jure uxoris upon his second marriage to his father's maternal first-cousin Mary I of England.

He died in El Escorial, near Madrid, on 13 September 1598, of cancer. He was succeeded by his 20-year-old son, Philip III from his 4th and last marriage.

September 17

1665

Today in Royal History is the 354th Death Anniversary of Philip IV (The Great); the 4th King of Spain from the House of Habsburg. He is the son of his predecessor Philip III and Margaret of Austria. He is also the last Habsburg King of Portugal after the House of Braganza deposed the House of Habsburg in the Portuguese Restoration War led by John II, Duke of Braganza, the rightful heir of the defunt House of Aviz.

He married twice and had 6 children having his youngest son Charles II succeed him on the throne after his death in 1665 and was buried at El Escorial in Spain.

1668

Today in Royal History is the 351st Birthday of Queen Maria Luisa of Spain born Princess Maria Luisa Gabrieela of Savoy, daughter of Victor Amadeus II, Duke of Savoy and Anne Marie d'Orléans. She married Philip V of Spain and had four sons, two of which became King but had no issue.

She also acted as Regent of Spain for 1 year in the absence of her spouse and was also his most trusted adviser, while she was in turn influenced by a French courtier, Marie Anne de La Trémoille, princesse des Ursins.

Queen Maria Luisa of Spain mother was a niece of Louis XIV of France

Indeed. Her mother's heritage is striking and imposing as Anne Marie d'Orléans is both a descendant of the House of Bourbon and Stuart.

One more trivia: Anne Marie's descendants could have been eligible to inherit the British crown under the Jacobite claim if not for the Act of Settlement which barred the claims of the Catholic Stuarts and d'Orléans' and settled the throne on the nearest Protestant relatives, the Hanoverians.

September 27

1760

Today in Royal History is the 259th Death Anniversary of Queen Maria Amalia of Spain born Princess Maria Amalia Christina Franziska Xaveria Flora Walburga of Saxony of the House of Wettin to King Augustus III of Poland, Elector of Saxony and Archduchess Maria Josepha of Austria. She was the wife of King Charles III of Spain who was also the King of Naples and Sicily and the Duke of Parma and Piacenza. Together they had 8 children.

She died at an early age of 35 at Buen Retiro Palace, Madrid, Spain.

On this day, October 3, 1568 ~ Demise of Elisabeth de Valois, the third wife of King Philip II

It was the Cardinal of Lorraine who broke the he news of the death Élisabeth de France to King Charles IX who reluctantly told his mother Catherine de Médicis who was at a Royal Council meeting.Catherine in a rare moment of human emotion left the room and went directly to her private chapel and retired to her private chambers to mourn her eldest daughter.

On this day, October 14, 1784 ~ Birth of King Ferdinand VII of Spain at El Escorial in Madrid

On this day, October 18, 1469 ~ The wedding of King Ferdinand II of Aragon and Queen Isabella I of Castile in Valladolid, Kingdom of Castile

On this day, October 23, 1503 ~ Birth of Isabel of Portugal. Queen of Spain, Holy Roman Empress in Lisbon Portugal. She was the spouse of King Charles I of Spain.

On this day, October 25, 1692 ~ Birth of Elizabeth Farnese, Queen of Spain, the second wife of King Philip V

https://www.alamy.com/elisabeth-far...rt-of-spain-wife-of-philip-image65707684.html

On this day, October 26, 1580 ~ Demise of Anna of Austria, Queen of Spain, the fourth wife of King Philip II

The Infanta Doña Juana was born at Toledo Castle in Castile at the time of her birth she had an older broth the Infante Don Juan and he was destined to be future king. Doña Juana also had an older sister The Infanta Doña Isabel later Princess of Asturias and Girona and queen consort of Portugal.

Ferdinand II,Doña Juana and Isabella I of Castile.
